str2: Immediately, soon, at once. Adverb from euthus; directly, i.e. At once or soon.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To stretch out (forth), cast forth (as of an anchor), lay hands on. From ek and teino; to extend.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To lay hold of, take hold of, seize (sometimes with beneficent, sometimes with hostile, intent).

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Of little faith. From oligos and pistis; incredulous, i.e. Lacking confidence.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To waver, doubt, hesitate. From dis; properly, to duplicate, i.e. to waver.
